node.title: What Queensland's incoming COVID rules mean for you
node.alt: Patrons wait at the bar at Black Bear Lodge, a venue in Fortitude Valley, Brisbane, taken on 240618
node.description: For mid-December, where you can go and what you can do will depend on whether or not you've had two COVID-19 vaccine doses. Here's what we know.
node.content:
["From mid-December, where you can go and what you can do will depend on whether or not you've had two COVID-19 vaccine doses.", "Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk says from December 17, or when 80 per cent of Queenslanders over 16 are fully vaccinated, those who are fully immunised will go about daily life with no restrictions at all.", "Here's what we know about the incoming changes.", "
What are the changes?
", "The Premier said people who are vaccinated have \"absolutely stepped up and done the right thing\".", "\"A vaccinated person is 86 per cent less likely to contract COVID\u00a0and are 90 per cent less likely to die,\" Ms Palaszczuk said.", "People who are unvaccinated, will be banned from attending several certain types of venues, with police set to enforce the regulations.", "These rules only apply to people over 16 years of age who are eligible to be vaccinated.", "
Where can I go if I'm vaccinated?
", "Fully vaccinated people can attend pubs, clubs, cafes, restaurants, cinemas, theatres, music festivals and\u00a0stadiums, where all staff also need to be\u00a0fully vaccinated.", "Government-owned galleries, museums and libraries will also be for the fully vaccinated only.", "Only fully immunised people will be able to visit hospitals, aged care facilities, prisons and disability services.", "There'll be no limit on weddings where all the guests are fully vaccinated.", "In all of these venues, the vaccination policy also applies to staff, performers, crew, caterers and athletes, etc.", "", "
Police Commissioner Katarina Carroll said venues should display the rules for entry.(Supplied: Dan Gold via Unsplash)
", "\"This is both a reward for the fully vaccinated and a precaution for when the borders open and we will see more cases in our community,\" Ms Palaszczuk said.", "\"People deserve to know that they can go to these places and that they are safe.\"", "
How will I prove I'm vaccinated to enter venues?
", "From November 17 people will be able to show their vaccination certificate on the Queensland check-in app.", "Staff at venues are encouraged to ask customers for proof of vaccination, but have been told to contact police if customers refuse.", "", "
Workers in venues have to be double vaccinated, as well as the patrons.(ABC News: John Gunn)
", "Police Commissioner Katarina Carroll said venues should display the rules for entry.", "\"We do expect venues to \u2026 display the vaccination rules [and]\u00a0ask for the evidence of vaccination. And if there is no evidence, they can obviously ask that person to leave and if they refuse to leave to call the police.", "\"It is not the venues role to be the police, we will do that for you.", "\"If people do not comply there will be enforcement action and as you know that enforcement action amounts to $1,378.\"", "
What if I'm not vaccinated?
", "", "
Unvaccinated people will only be able to enter hospitals in end-of-life or emergency situations.(ABC North West Queensland: Kelly Butterworth)
", "People who are not vaccinated will only be able to enter hospitals in end-of-life or emergency situations.", "They will also still be eligible to attend weddings, but there will be a cap with a maximum of 20 people, including the wedding party and officials permitted.", "All other settings, including public transport and essential retail, will still be open to the unvaccinated.", "
What do the changes mean for businesses?
", "Once December 17 arrives, businesses will be able to operate at full capacity again.", "Health Minister Yvette D'Ath said there will be no caps on density, should everyone be fully vaccinated at the business, this includes staff and patrons.", "\"I know that's going to be exciting news for younger people who like going to music concerts and going dancing at pubs and clubs, we will have 100 per cent capacity again because of these new rules,\" the Health Minister said.", "
What other changes are coming into effect on December 17?\u00a0
", "There will be a significant change to Queensland's border rules, when the state is expected to hit the 80 per cent vaccination target.\u00a0", "For the first time in months, people will be able to enter Queensland from a declared interstate hotspot by road as well as by air.", "But there are some requirements that must be met first.\u00a0", "Those crossing the border from a hotspot must be fully vaccinated and test negative to COVID-19 within previous 72 hours.\u00a0", "Anyone who doesn't meet the criteria will still be required to do a period of quarantine in a government-nominated facility.", "", "
Outbreak: How Australia lost control of the Delta variant
"]
